name: Dieter van Dödel
notes: Dieters parents were tradespeople in small halfing settlement, he was the youngest sibling of 4, but on the day of his birth the town was raided and his 3 older siblings were slain right in front of him. As they drew their last breaths Dieter could see apparitions of them detaching from their bodies. After that he grew up to be a loner in school, and when he finally dropped out he fell in with a bad crowd. After a while a gang boss offered him a job, to destroy the reputation of an opposing gangs leader, the pay was good so he accepted. He didn't feel any regret or guilt. In the ensuing gang war he was hired time and time again to do different things - stealing, killing, and negative PR were his best trade. After the dust had settled a bit, he found the woman of his dreams and finally settled down, but it didn't hold for long as his deeds in the gang war came to haunt him. They killed his then wife, again in front of him...but then he noticed something weird, he again saw an apparition detach from her body, but this time he knew what it was: her soul! After a time of anguish he hardened his resolve and went out adventuring, to try and find the souls of his lost ones...

feats.name: Deadly Aim
feats.notes: Trade ranged attack bonus for damage.

feats.name: Axe to Grind
feats.notes: You gain a +1 trait bonus on damage against foes who are threatened by only you.

feats.name: Glimpse Beyond
feats.notes:
Benefit:
You gain a +2 bonus on Knowledge (dungeoneering) checks to identify the vulnerabilities and powers of aberrations, Knowledge (planes) checks to identify the vulnerabilities and powers of evil outsiders, and Knowledge (religion) checks to identify the vulnerabilities and powers of undead, and you can make such checks untrained. If you have 10 or more ranks in any of these Knowledge skills, the bonus increases to + 4 for the appropriate skill. In addition, you gain a +2 bonus on saves against fear effects.

Goal:
Be killed or driven insane (as determined by the GM) by an aberration, evil outsider, or undead. This leaves your mind permanently marked.

Completion Benefit:
Any sane creature that attempts to read your thoughts takes 1d6 points of Wisdom damage (Will DC 10 + 1/2 your level + your Charisma modified negates). In addition, the effect of any ability damage, ability drain, or penalty to your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is halved (minimum 1). You take a -2 penalty on Will saving throws. Whenever you roll a save against a mind-affecting effect, roll twice and keep the better result.

feats.name: Point-Blank Shot
feats.notes: You get a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons at ranges of up to 30 feet.

specialAbilities.name: Weapon and Armor Proficiency
specialAbilities.notes: Rogues are proficient with all simple weapons, plus the hand crossbow, rapier, sap, shortbow, and short sword. They are proficient with light armor, but not with shields.

specialAbilities.name: Sneak Attack
specialAbilities.notes: If a rogue can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her attack, she can strike a vital spot for extra damage. The rogue’s attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a Dexterity bonus to AC (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the rogue flanks her target. This extra damage is 1d6 at 1st level, and increases by 1d6 every two rogue levels thereafter. Should the rogue score a critical hit with a sneak attack, this extra damage is not multiplied. Ranged attacks can count as sneak attacks only if the target is within 30 feet. With a weapon that deals nonlethal damage (like a sap, whip, or an unarmed strike), a rogue can make a sneak attack that deals nonlethal damage instead of lethal damage. She cannot use a weapon that deals lethal damage deal nonlethal damage in a sneak attack, not even with the usual –4 penalty. The rogue must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to reach such a spot. A rogue cannot sneak attack while striking a creature with concealment.

specialAbilities.name: Accuracy
specialAbilities.notes: At 1st level, a sniper halves all range increment penalties when making ranged attacks with a bow or crossbow.

At 2nd level and higher, a rogue can avoid even magical and unusual attacks with great agility. If she makes a successful Reflex saving throw against an attack that normally deals half damage on a successful save, she instead takes no damage. Evasion can be used only if the rogue is wearing light armor or no armor. A helpless rogue does not gain the benefit of evasion.
specialAbilities.name: Evasion
Sniper's Eye
specialAbilities.notes: A rogue with this talent can apply her sneak attack damage on ranged attacks targeting foes within 30 feet that benefit from concealment. Foes with total concealment are still immune.

specialAbilities.name: Deadly Range
specialAbilities.notes: At 3rd level, a sniper increases the range at which she can apply her sneak attack damage by 10 feet. This range increases by 10 feet for every 3 levels after 3rd.

specialAbilities.name: Uncanny Dodge
specialAbilities.notes: Starting at 4th level, a rogue can react to danger before her senses would normally allow her to do so. She cannot be caught flat-footed, nor does she lose her Dex bonus to AC if the attacker is invisible. She still loses her Dexterity bonus to AC if immobilized. A rogue with this ability can still lose her Dexterity bonus to AC if an opponent successfully uses the feint action (see Combat) against her.

specialAbilities.name: Minor Magic
specialAbilities.notes: A rogue with this talent gains the ability to cast a 0-level spell from the sorcerer/wizard spell list. This spell can be cast three times a day as a spell-like ability. The caster level for this ability is equal to the rogue's level. The save DC for this spell is 10 + the rogue's Intelligence modifier. The rogue must have an Intelligence of at least 10 to select this talent.

gear.name: Thieves Tools
gear.notes: This kit contains lockpicks and other tools you need to use the Disable Device skill. Without these tools, you must use improvised tools, and you take a –2 circumstance penalty on Disable Device checks.

gear.name: Grappling hook
gear.notes: Throwing a grappling hook requires a ranged attack roll, treating the hook as a thrown weapon with a range increment of 10 feet. Objects with ample places to catch the hook are AC 5.

2x Earrings
2x Armbands with Pearls
1x golden necklace
1x silver necklace
1x saphire locket
gear.name: Jewled Box
Climbers Kit
gear.notes: These crampons, pitons, ropes, and other tools give you a +2 circumstance bonus on Climb checks.

traits.name: Civilised
traits.notes: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (nobility) checks and Knowledge (local) checks. Knowledge (local) is always a class skill for you.
You gain a +1 trait bonus on Diplomacy checks to gather information and Knowledge (local) checks. One of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.
traits.name: Well Informed
Kin Guardian combat trait
traits.notes: When you use the aid another action to give a member of your family a bonus to AC, increase the bonus by 2. This increase is a trait bonus (and therefore doesn’t stack with increases granted by other family members using this trait). This trait has no effect when using the aid another action to increase a family member’s next attack roll.

traits.name: Bastard
traits.notes: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Sense Motive checks, and Sense Motive is always a class skill for you.

traits.name: Child of the Streets
traits.notes: You gain a +1 trait bonus on Sleight of Hand checks, and Sleight of Hand is always a class skill for you.

traits.name: Dirty Fighter
traits.notes: When you hit a foe you are flanking, you deal 1 additional point of damage (this damage is added to your base damage, and is multiplied on a critical hit). This additional damage is a trait bonus.

traits.name: Deathtouched (Bloodline)
traits.notes: You gain either a +1 trait bonus on Fortitude saving throws or a +2 trait bonus on saving throws against mind-affecting effects (your choice).

traits.name: Fearless
traits.notes: Halflings receive a +2 racial bonus on all saving throws against fear. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by halfling luck.
